intro: Palmerocassia wislizeni, commonly known as the wislizeni palmerocassia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, legume-like pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Palmerocassia wislizeni is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
